intro: Brachycorythis peitawuensis, commonly known as the Peitawu endemic palm, is a rare and unique species native to the island of Peitawu in the South China Sea. It is a small palm with a short, stout trunk and dense, feather-like leaves. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit, with its foliage forming a tight, rounded canopy. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing at the base of the leaves, and it produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
